labels.analysis: The MCP Server "MyTime" is primarily focused on time management and productivity enhancement. Its description emphasizes scheduling, task tracking, and workflow integration to help users manage their time more effectively. The available tools, while limited in the example provided ("get_current_time" and "add_num"), suggest foundational capabilities for time-related operations and basic numerical calculations. The server appears to align with productivity and time organization functionalities.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Time & Calendar" is chosen because the serverâ€™s core functionality revolves around time management, which includes scheduling and tracking. The secondary label "Daily Productivity" is added because the description highlights enhancing productivity through time management. The "get_current_time" tool directly supports time-related operations, reinforcing these categories. The "add_num" tool is less central but may assist in time-based calculations or productivity tracking.

server_info_crawled.name: MyTime
server_info_crawled.author: @DocumentLess/mytime
server_info_crawled.overview: Manage your time effectively with our intuitive scheduling and tracking tools. Streamline your daily tasks and enhance productivity with seamless integration into your workflow. Experience a smarter way to organize your time and achieve your goals.
server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@DocumentLess/mytime/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
